name: 9.2 "Cheers Fouls Out" Online Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 9 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who had the pictures that Rebecca took of herself?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Rebecca had taken some sexual pictures of herself to give to Robin in prison. Carla got a hold of them and was selling them off.

questions.correct: To be eligible to play in the employee basketball game
options: To fullfill his life long dream of working the kegs
To be eligible to play in the employee basketball game
Woody called in sick and Sam needed an emergency bartender
To work off some of his bar tab
questions.explanation:
To be eligible to play in the employee basketball game.

	Frasier walked in the bar and said he was in one of Norm's dreams. Norm told him he had to work an hour to qualify to be in the employee basketball game, however, he said his dreams were very similar to what he was doing at the bar that day.

	Frasier told the gang about this and that he answered "You look fine." As a result he said, "I'm not getting any". By that he meant she refused to have sex with him or even any kind of sexual contact. Norm said to him, "You're getting off easy."

questions.text: Who did Cliff say invented the game of basketball?
questions.explanation:
the ancient Celtics.

	Once again, Cliff's facts were not factual. Basketball was invented by James Naismith in 1891 for a training at the YMCA.

questions.text: Why did Woody think Gary was a rat?
options: He gave Woody a job then fired him.
He stole Kelly away from Woody.
questions.explanation:
He stole Sam's basketball.

	Sam thought Woody called Gary a rat for bringing in two ringers to play in the basketball game. Woody told him that it was because he stole Sam's ball. Sam said that was his favorite ball, too.

questions.text: Where did Woody say Larry Bird was from?
questions.explanation:
French Lick, Indiana.

	Larry Bird was actually born in West Baden Springs, IN. However, he grew up in French Lick. Woody said that French Lick was the doofus capital of the world.

questions.text: What Boston Celtics player played on the Cheers team?
questions.explanation:
Kevin McHale.

	Kevin McHale is 6'10" tall. He agreed to play if they gave all the money they won to charity, specifically an orphanage. They wanted to beat Gary so badly, they agreed.

questions.text: Why can't the Celtics player serve alcohol?
options: He had a game that night.
questions.explanation:
Against NBA policy.

	Sam said that McHale would be serving only water. Norm said "To whom?" So Sam explained how the NBA didn't want it's athletes promoting drugs or alcohol.

questions.text: How much did Sam bet on the game?
questions.explanation:
$5000.

	The way they felt was if they lost they'd be giving their money to Gary. However, if they won, it would be Gary's money that they would be giving to charity.

The Celtics player.

	Frasier had just told Sam he ought to take Kevin out because he's been playing too hard. Sam said he'd be fine and then we hear a scream and find out McHale twisted his ankle.
